channel.description:
New Max Payne 3 trailer released:
[url='https://www.nowgamer.com/news/1054478/max_payne_3_debut_trailer_live_at_five.html']https://www.nowgamer.com/news/1054478/max_payne_3_debut_trailer_live_at_five.html[/url]
I thought the first 2 games were fantastic, i just loved the gloomy atmosphere of the game and the story line and i hope this one will live up to that.
However its now set it Brazil instead of New York in the middle of a snow storm, im not sure this is the best location for the type of game its intended to be. What do you all think?

item.title: Max Payne 3
item.dc:creator: baz_uk
item.description:
Its odd, I would have usually really enjoyed these games!

However, I just found the first one really repetitive and the strange dream stuff you had really ruined it! I know it was telling a story, but it just didn’t fit well for me - soz

I gave the second a miss.

After seeing videos of the third, at first I thought it looked awful, but for some strange reason it is growing on me and I may give it a go when it comes down in price. It looks sort of ‘Die Hard’ and not so 'romance-y, tragic and depressing!

No offense intended to anybody, I certainly can see why people love these games, I thought I would be one, but just didn’t grab me…??

I can also see why fans of 1 and 2 are getting a little worried about the third, but as stated, it needs to move to something different, other wise it would be just another re-make??

item.title: Max Payne 3
item.dc:creator: ShadowNate
item.description:
I’m a huge fan of the Max Payne games (and one of the main creators for a Max Payne mod). I was/am quite sceptical about a third installment and the new premise (initially it sounded like a joke -and also the sample(?) box art IS a joke), but I think I am leaning towards a “so far so good” opinion.

I mostly liked what I saw in the new (and short) trailer, and they did intentionally put in a few callbacks to the original series. I would like to see gameplay videos but I know that now I am more interested than I was a few years ago. Also, it appears (to an outsider) that they certainly did not rush the game’s development, so that could be good.
